sections.title: Overview
content: Locator is a simple tool for geocoding a list of locations and displaying them on a minimalist world map. It is designed for quick, internal visualization tasks and requires no sign-ups to use.

sections.title: How to Use
content: 1. Add Locations: Type or paste location names into the text area. Separate each location with a semicolon (;) or a new line.
2. Add to Map: Click the 'Add to Map' button. The app will process each location one by one.

3. Resolve Ambiguity: If a location name has multiple possible matches (e.g., 'Springfield'), a popup will appear. Select the correct one from the list and click 'Select', or click 'Skip' to ignore it.
4. Manage the List: Each successfully added location appears in the list on the left. You can use the buttons to:
- ‚úèÔ∏è Rename: Edit the location's label on the map.
- üîç Zoom To: Pan and zoom the map to that location.
- üóëÔ∏è Remove: Delete the location from the map and the list.
5. Fill Countries: Check the 'Fill Countries' box to highlight the countries where you have placed locations.

sections.title: Technical Stack
content: Dependencies: All dependencies are loaded via CDN and require no local installation.

sections.title: Data Sources
content: Base Map: Country outlines are from Natural Earth (Public Domain).
Geocoding (Search): Location search is performed using the public Nominatim API, which uses OpenStreetMap data.
Compliance: To respect Nominatim's usage policy, this tool sends a unique User-Agent header and enforces a 1-second delay between search requests.
